questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Which of the following is 'a' FALSE statement ?

option_texts.A: Carius method is used for the estimation of nitrogen in an organic compound.
option_texts.B: Kjeldahl's method is used for the estimation of nitrogen in an organic compound.
option_texts.C: Carius tube is used in the estimation of sulphur in an organic compound.
option_texts.D: Phosphoric acid produced on oxidation of phosphorus present in an organic compound is precipitated as Mg_{2}P_{2}O_{7} by adding magnesia mixture.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
Find A, B and C in the following reactions :

$$N{H_3} + A + C{O_2} \to {(N{H_4})_2}C{O_3}$$

$${(N{H_4})_2}C{O_3} + {H_2}O + B \to N{H_4}HC{O_3}$$

$$N{H_4}HC{O_3} + NaCl \to N{H_4}Cl + C$$

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:

    List I
 Electronic configuration

 $${\Delta _i}H$$ in kJ $$mo{l^{ - 1}}$$

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
Given below are two statements :

Statement I : A mixture of chloroform and aniline can be separated by simple distillation.

Statement II : When separating aniline from a mixture of aniline and water by steam distillation aniline boils below its boiling point.

In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below :

option_texts.A: Both Statement I and Statement II are true
option_texts.B: Both Statement I and Statement II are false
option_texts.C: Statement I is true but Statement II is false
option_texts.D: Statement I is false but Statement II is true

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
Given below are two statements : one is labelled as Assertion A and the other is labelled as Reason R.

Assertion A : Dipole-dipole interactions are the only non-covalent interactions, resulting in hydrogen bond formation.

Reason R : Fluorine is the most electronegative element and hydrogen bonds in HF are symmetrical.

In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below :

option_texts.A: Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A
option_texts.B: A is true but R is false
option_texts.C: A is false but R is true
option_texts.D: Both A and R are true but R is NOT the correct explanation of A

questions.question_text: Which one of the following lanthanoids does not form MO2? [M is lanthanoid metal]

questions.question_text: Compound A used as a strong oxidizing agent is amphoteric in nature. It is the part of lead storage batteries. Compound A is :

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Identify the major products A and B respectively in the following reactions of phenol :

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: An amine on reaction with benzensulphonyl chloride produces a compound insoluble in alkaline solution. This amine can be prepared by ammonolysis of ethyl chloride. The correct structure of amine is :

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
Given below are two statements : 

Statement I : o-Nitrophenol is steam volatile due to intramolecular hydrogen bonding.

Statement II : o-Nitrophenol has high melting due to hydrogen bonding.

In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below :

option_texts.A: Both Statement I and Statement II are true
option_texts.B: Statement I is true but Statement II is false
option_texts.C: Statement I is false but Statement II is true
option_texts.D: Both Statement I and Statement II are false

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: B reacts with Hydroxyl amine but does not give Tollen's test. Identify A and B.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Which of the following vitamin is helpful in delaying the blood clotting?

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: The orbital having two radial as well as two angular nodes is :

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
For a chemical reaction A + B ⇌ C + D

($${\Delta _r}{H^\Theta }$$ = 80 kJ mol$$-$$1) the entropy change $${\Delta _r}{S^\Theta }$$ depends on the temperature T (in K) as $${\Delta _r}{S^\Theta }$$ = 2T (J K$$-$$1mol$$-$$1).

Minimum temperature at which it will become spontaneous is ___________ K. (Integer)

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: An exothermic reaction X $$ \to $$ Y has an activation energy 30 kJ mol$$-$$1. If energy change $$\Delta$$E during the reaction is $$-$$20 kJ, then the activation energy for the reverse reaction in kJ is ___________. (Integer answer)

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Dichromate ion is treated with base, the oxidation number of Cr in the product formed is ___________.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Number of bridging CO ligands in [Mn2(CO)10] is __________.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
Consider the following reaction

$$MnO_4^ -  + 8{H^ + } + 5{e^ - } \to M{n^{ + 2}} + 4{H_2}O,{E^o} = 1.51V$$.

The quantity of electricity required in Faraday to reduce five moles of $$MnO_4^ - $$ is ___________. (Integer answer)

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: 224 mL of SO2(g) at 298 K and 1 atm is passed through 100 mL of 0.1 M NaOH solution. The non-volatile solute produced is dissolved in 36g of water. The lowering of vapour pressure of solution (assuming the solution in dilute) (P$$_{({H_2}O)}^o$$ $$-$$ 24 mm of Hg) is x $$\times$$ 10$$-$$2 mm of Hg, the value of x is ___________. (Integer answer)

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
A homogeneous ideal gaseous reaction $$A{B_{2(g)}} \rightleftharpoons {A_{(g)}} + 2{B_{(g)}}$$ is carried out in a 25 litre flask at 27$$^\circ$$C. The initial amount of AB2 was 1 mole and the equilibrium pressure was 1.9 atm. The value of Kp is x $$\times$$ 10$$-$$2. The value of x is _________. (Integer answer)

[R = 0.08206 dm3atm K$$-$$1mol$$-$$1]

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
The maximum value of the term independent of 't' in the expansion 
of $${\left( {t{x^{{1 \over 5}}} + {{{{(1 - x)}^{{1 \over {10}}}}} \over t}} \right)^{10}}$$ where x$$\in$$(0, 1) is :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: The value of $$\mathop {\lim }\limits_{h \to 0} 2\left\{ {{{\sqrt 3 \sin \left( {{\pi  \over 6} + h} \right) - \cos \left( {{\pi  \over 6} + h} \right)} \over {\sqrt 3 h\left( {\sqrt 3 \cosh  - \sinh } \right)}}} \right\}$$ is :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let A be a symmetric matrix of order 2 with integer entries. If the sum of the diagonal elements of A2 is 1, then the possible number of such matrices is :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: The value of $$\int\limits_{ - \pi /2}^{\pi /2} {{{{{\cos }^2}x} \over {1 + {3^x}}}} dx$$ is :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: The number of seven digit integers with sum of the digits equal to 10 and formed by using the digits 1, 2 and 3 only is :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let R = {(P, Q) | P and Q are at the same distance from the origin} be a relation, then the equivalence class of (1, $$-$$1) is the set :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: The value of $$\sum\limits_{n = 1}^{100} {\int\limits_{n - 1}^n {{e^{x - [x]}}dx} } $$, where [ x ] is the greatest integer $$ \le $$ x, is :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: The intersection of three lines x $$-$$ y = 0, x + 2y = 3 and 2x + y = 6 is a :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: In the circle given below, let OA = 1 unit, OB = 13 unit and PQ $$ \bot $$ OB. Then, the area of the triangle PQB (in square units) is :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
If $${{{{\sin }^1}x} \over a} = {{{{\cos }^{ - 1}}x} \over b} = {{{{\tan }^{ - 1}}y} \over c}$$; $$0 < x < 1$$, 
then the value of $$\cos \left( {{{\pi c} \over {a + b}}} \right)$$ is :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: The maximum slope of the curve $$y = {1 \over 2}{x^4} - 5{x^3} + 18{x^2} - 19x$$ occurs at the point :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: The rate of growth of bacteria in a culture is proportional to the number of bacteria present and the bacteria count is 1000 at initial time t = 0. The number of bacteria is increased by 20% in 2 hours. If the population of bacteria is 2000 after $${k \over {{{\log }_e}\left( {{6 \over 5}} \right)}}$$ hours, then $${\left( {{k \over {{{\log }_e}2}}} \right)^2}$$ is equal to :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: In an increasing geometric series, the sum of the second and the sixth term is $${{25} \over 2}$$ and the product of the third and fifth term is 25. Then, the sum of 4th, 6th and 8th terms is equal to :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: The value of the integral $$\int\limits_0^\pi  {|{{\sin }\,}2x|dx} $$ is ___________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: The number of solutions of the equation log4(x $$-$$ 1) = log2(x $$-$$ 3) is _________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: The sum of 162th power of the roots of the equation x3 $$-$$ 2x2 + 2x $$-$$ 1 = 0 is ________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: The area bounded by the lines y = || x $$-$$ 1 | $$-$$ 2 | is ___________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: The difference between degree and order of a differential equation that represents the family of curves given by $${y^2} = a\left( {x + {{\sqrt a } \over 2}} \right)$$, a > 0 is _________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
If y = y(x) is the solution of the equation 

$${e^{\sin y}}\cos y{{dy} \over {dx}} + {e^{\sin y}}\cos x = \cos x$$, y(0) = 0; then 

$$1 + y\left( {{\pi  \over 6}} \right) + {{\sqrt 3 } \over 2}y\left( {{\pi  \over 3}} \right) + {1 \over {\sqrt 2 }}y\left( {{\pi  \over 4}} \right)$$ is equal to ____________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: The number of integral values of 'k' for which the equation $$3\sin x + 4\cos x = k + 1$$ has a solution, k$$\in$$R is ___________.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Consider the combination of 2 capacitors C1 and C2 with C2 > C1, when connected in parallel, the equivalent capacitance is $${{15} \over 4}$$ times the equivalent capacitance of the same connected in series. Calculate the ratio of capacitors, $${{{C_2}} \over {{C_1}}}$$.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: An alternating current is given by the equation i = i1 sin $$\omega$$t + i2 cos $$\omega$$t. The rms current will be :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Four identical solid spheres each of mass 'm' and radius 'a' are placed with their centres on the four corners of a square of side 'b'. The moment of inertia of the system about one side of square where the axis of rotation is parallel to the plane of the square is :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A large number of water drops, each of radius r, combine to have a drop of radius R. If the surface tension is T and mechanical equivalent of heat is J, the rise in heat energy per unit volume will be :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
LED is constructed from Ga-As-P semiconducting material. The energy gap of this LED is 1.9 eV. Calculate the wavelength of light emitted and its colour.

[h = 6.63 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$34 Js and c = 3 $$\times$$ 108 ms$$-$$1]

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A short straight object of height 100 cm lies before the central axis of a spherical mirror whose focal length has absolute value | f | = 40 cm. The image of object produced by the mirror is of height 25 cm and has the same orientation of the object. One may conclude from the information :

option_texts.A: Image is real, same side of convex mirror.
option_texts.B: Image is virtual, opposite side of convex mirror.
option_texts.C: Image is virtual, opposite side of concave mirror.
option_texts.D: Image is real, same side of concave mirror.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: In a Young's double slit experiment two slits are separated by 2 mm and the screen is placed one meter away. When a light of wavelength 500 nm is used, the fringe separation will be :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Assume that a tunnel is dug along a chord of the earth, at a perpendicular distance (R/2) from the earth's centre, where 'R' is the radius of the Earth. The wall of the tunnel is frictionless. If a particle is released in this tunnel, it will execute a simple harmonic motion with a time period :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: In a typical combustion engine the workdone by a gas molecule is given by $$W = {\alpha ^2}\beta {e^{{{ - \beta {x^2}} \over {kT}}}}$$, where x is the displacement, k is the Boltzmann constant and T is the temperature. If $$\alpha$$ and $$\beta$$ are constants, dimensions of $$\alpha$$ will be :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: If two similar springs each of spring constant K1 are joined in series, the new spring constant and time period would be changed by a factor :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A particle is moving with uniform speed along the circumference of a circle of radius R under the action of a central fictitious force F which is inversely proportional to R3. Its time period of revolution will be given by :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The temperature $$\theta$$ at the junction of two insulating sheets, having thermal resistances R1 and R2 as well as top and bottom temperatures $$\theta$$1 and $$\theta$$2 (as shown in figure) is given by :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Find the electric field at point P (as shown in figure) on the perpendicular bisector of a uniformly charged thin wire of length L carrying a charge Q. The distance of the point P from the centre of the rod is a = $${{\sqrt 3 } \over 2}L$$.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
A planet revolving in elliptical orbit has :

A. a constant velocity of revolution.

B. has the least velocity when it is nearest to the sun.

C. its areal velocity is directly proportional to its velocity.

D. areal velocity is inversely proportional to its velocity.

E. to follow a trajectory such that the areal velocity is constant.

Choose the correct answer from the options given below :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
Given below are two statements : one is labeled as Assertion A and the other is labelled as Reason R.

Assertion A : An electron microscope can achieve better resolving power than an optical microscope.

Reason R : The de Broglie's wavelength of the electrons emitted from an electron gun is much less than wavelength of visible light.

In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below :

option_texts.A: A is false but R is true.
option_texts.B: Both A and R are true but R is NOT the correct explanation of A.
option_texts.C: Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A.
option_texts.D: A is true but R is false.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
Given below are two statements : one is labelled as Assertion A and the other is labelled as Reason R.

Assertion A : Body 'P' having mass M moving with speed 'u' has head-on collision elastically with another body 'Q' having mass 'm' initially at rest. If m << M, body 'Q' will have a maximum speed equal to '2u' after collision.

Reason R : During elastic collision, the momentum and kinetic energy are both conserved.

In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below :

option_texts.A: A is correct but R is not correct.
option_texts.B: A is not correct but R is correct.
option_texts.C: Both A and R are correct and R is the correct explanation of A.
option_texts.D: Both A and R are correct but R is NOT the correct explanation of A.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The normal density of a material is $$\rho$$ and its bulk modulus of elasticity is K. The magnitude of increase in density of material, when a pressure P is applied uniformly on all sides, will be :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: If $$\lambda$$1 and $$\lambda$$2 are the wavelengths of the third member of Lyman and first member of the Paschen series respectively, then the value of $$\lambda$$1 : $$\lambda$$2 is :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Find the gravitational force of attraction between the ring and sphere as shown in the diagram, where the plane of the ring is perpendicular to the line joining the centres. If $$\sqrt 8 $$R is the distance between the centres of a ring (of mass 'm') and a sphere (mass 'M') where both have equal radius 'R'.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Five equal resistances are connected in a network as shown in figure. The net resistance between the points A and B is :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A person standing on a spring balance inside a stationary lift measures 60 kg. The weight of that person if the lift descends with uniform downward acceleration of 1.8 m/s2 will be ______________ N. [g = 10 m/s2]

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The circuit contains two diodes each with a forward resistance of 50$$\Omega$$ and with infinite reverse resistance. If the battery voltage is 6V, the current through the 120$$\Omega$$ resistance is ____________ mA.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: In a series LCR resonant circuit, the quality factor is measured as 100. If the inductance is increased by two fold and resistance is decreased by two fold, then the quality factor after this change will be __________.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The mass per unit length of a uniform wire is 0.135 g/cm. A transverse wave of the form y = $$-$$ 0.21 sin (x + 30t) is produced in it, where x is in meter and t is in second. Then, the expected value of tension in the wire is x $$\times$$ 10$$-$$2 N. Value of x is _________. (Round off to the nearest integer)

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: In an electrical circuit, a battery is connected to pass 20C of charge through it in a certain given time. The potential difference between two plates of the battery is maintained at 15V. The workdone by the battery is __________J.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A boy pushes a box of mass 2 kg with a force $$\overrightarrow F  = \left( {20\widehat i + 10\widehat j} \right)N$$ on a frictionless surface. If the box was initially at rest, then ___________ m is displacement along the x-axis after 10s.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A radiation is emitted by 1000W bulb and it generates an electric field and magnetic field at P, placed at a distance of 2m. The efficiency of the bulb is 1.25%. The value of peak electric field at P is x $$\times$$ 10$$-$$1 V/m. Value of x is ___________. (Rounded off to the nearest integer) [Take $${\varepsilon _0} = 8.85 \times {10^{ - 12}}$$ C2N$$-$$1 m$$-$$2, c = $$3 \times {10^8}$$ ms$$-$$1]

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A container is divided into two chambers by a partition. The volume of first chamber is 4.5 litre and second chamber is 5.5 litre. The first chamber contain 3.0 moles of gas at pressure 2.0 atm and second chamber contain 4.0 moles of gas at pressure 3.0 atm. After the partition is removed and the mixture attains equilibrium, then, the common equilibrium pressure existing in the mixture is x $$\times$$ 10$$-$$1 atm. Value of x is ________.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
As shown in the figure, a block of mass $$\sqrt 3 $$ kg is kept on a horizontal rough surface of coefficient of friction $${1 \over {3\sqrt 3 }}$$. The critical force to be applied on the vertical surface as shown at an angle 60$$^\circ$$ with horizontal such that it does not move, will be 3x. The value of x will be _________.

 [g = 10 m/s2; sin60$$^\circ$$ = $${{\sqrt 3 } \over 2}$$; cos60$$^\circ$$ = $${1 \over 2}$$]
